pull.title: devtools: Fetch and display ACKs at sign-off time in github-merge
pull.body:
- Fetch the ACKs only at sign-off time. This makes sure that any last-minute ACKs are included (fixes #16200)
- Show a list of ACKs that will be included and their author before signing off, and warn if there are none

![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/126646/59605250-ad070980-910e-11e9-9f9a-d789c7f06ebb.png)
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/126646/59605255-b1332700-910e-11e9-80a5-d1e244f48264.png)

There's a slight change to the merge commit formatâ€”before it was
```
    ACKs for commit 88884c:
(list of ACKs, could be empty)
```
now it is
```
ACKs for top commit:
      jnewbery:
        ACK 5ebc6b0eb
    ... (list of ACKs cannot be empty)
```
or
```
Top commit has no ACKs.
```
I don't think there's a reason to have the abbreviated commit ID there, after all the full commit id is already in the beginning of the merge commit message, and at least the abbreviated one is in every single ACK message.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.message:
devtools: Fetch and display ACKs at sign-off time in github-merge

- Fetch the ACKs only at sign-off time. This makes sure that any
  last-minute ACKs are included (fixes #16200)
- Show a list of ACKs and their author before signing off, and warn if
  there are none

events.body: This could also check "signed ACKs" (and say, mark them specially, if they match the expected key for the user) if we're going there in the future.
@laanwj I was going to suggest that as a stretch goal, so concept ACK that. Would be nice to see local pgp sigs validated.

FWIW I merged 15651 using this, seems to work as expected:

![merge 15651](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/126646/59697903-ee6ee600-91ee-11e9-80c8-e2a349f172e3.png)

ACK 0e01e4522e0f9e2e994f80fc61f40d61a4a70d79

Did some quick testing merging this PR on master (c8fee6769a106bb5fbcdd3674fd0444b01d3391c), then merging another PR on top.

PR with `ACKs`:
![some ACKs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/60009605-bf51ec00-96a8-11e9-918a-9b7ceb7fb940.png)

PR with no `ACKs`:
![no ACKs](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/863730/60009600-bcef9200-96a8-11e9-939c-5ade5c4b97b9.png)

@laanwj can you update the "now it is" section in PR description? As it does not seem to reflect how ACKs are displayed in this PR.
@laanwj @instagibbs Opened #16280 to track the pgp related github-merge additions.
